questions.question_text_1: Which of the following is true regarding sinusoidal encoding?
question_texts: Which of the following is true regarding sinusoidal encoding?

options.option_text: The encoding vector of words present at even positions in the given textsequence uses sine, and the encoding vector of words present at odd positions uses cosine.
The encoding vector of words present at odd positions in the given textsequence uses sine, and the encoding vector of words present at even positions uses cosine.
The encoding vector for each word position contains values computed usingboth sine (for even dimensions) and cosine (for odd dimensions).
‘content’
‘je’
‘suis’
‘heureux’

questions.question_text_1: In the context of language model training, teacher forcing is a technique where:
question_texts: In the context of language model training, teacher forcing is a technique where:

options.option_text: The correct target tokens from the training data are used as input for the nexttime step, regardless of the model’s prediction.
The model’s predictions are used as the input for the next time step, even ifthey are incorrect.
The model is forced to learn without any pre-trained weights.
The model is forced to correct the input data.

questions.question_text_1: For a vocabulary size of 10, how many beams will there be in greedy search, beam search with beam size 3, and exhaustive search at step 1 and step 3, respectively?
question_texts: For a vocabulary size of 10, how many beams will there be in greedy search, beam search with beam size 3, and exhaustive search at step 1 and step 3, respectively?

options.option_text: Step 1:Greedy: 1, Beam: 1, Exhaustive: 1 Step 3: Greedy: 1, Beam: 1, Exhaustive: 1
Step 1:Greedy: 1, Beam: 3, Exhaustive: 10 Step 3: Greedy: 1, Beam: 3, Exhaustive: 10
Step 1:Greedy: 1, Beam: 3, Exhaustive: 1 Step 3: Greedy: 1, Beam: 3, Exhaustive: 100
Step 1:Greedy: 1, Beam: 3, Exhaustive: 10 Step 3: Greedy: 1, Beam: 3, Exhaustive: 1000

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following decoding strategies is/are inherently non-deterministic?
question_texts: Which of the following decoding strategies is/are inherently non-deterministic?

options.option_text: Beam
Greedy
Nucleus
Exhaustive

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following statements about multiple attention heads in a Transformer are true?
question_texts: Which of the following statements about multiple attention heads in a Transformer are true?

options.option_text: They allow learning diverse local/global relations.
They reduce memory usage compared to one head.
Increasing the number of heads while keeping dmodel fixed, decreases thedimensionality handled by each head.
All heads necessarily learn completely independent information about theinput.

questions.question_text_1: Which of the following statements about the Transformer architecture are true?
question_texts: Which of the following statements about the Transformer architecture are true?

options.option_text: Masking (look-ahead mask) is applied in every decoder self-attention layer, notjust the first one.
Token embeddings are used in the encoder but not in the decoder.
Positional encoding is required only in the encoder, not in the decoder.
Token embeddings are used in both the encoder and the decoder.
Positional encodings are added to the input embeddings in both the encoderand the decoder.
Beam search with beam size 2 will keep either A or B as per probabilitywhereas Top-2 sampling will keep both A and B.
Beam search with beam size 2 will keep both A and B whereas Top-2 samplingwill keep either A or B.
Beam search with beam size 2 will randomly choose any two tokens, whereasTop-2 sampling will always pick the two least probable tokens.
Beam search with beam size 2 will always keep the top-2 most probabletokens, whereas Top-2 sampling will restrict choices to top-2 tokens and then sample one probabilistically.

questions.question_text_1: How many next-token prediction targets are generated during training a full batch?
question_texts: How many next-token prediction targets are generated during training a full batch?

questions.question_text_1: For one sequence, how many non-zero attention scores remain in the masked attention score matrix (per head)?
question_texts: For one sequence, how many non-zero attention scores remain in the masked attention score matrix (per head)?

options.option_text: The model can generate all tokens in parallel.
Each new token is generated conditioned on previously generated tokens.
Teacher forcing is used to stabilize outputs.
Beam search or other decoding strategies are commonly used to decide thenext token.
